wikipedia_page.main: Kendrick Stark was a rugby union international who represented England from 1927 to 1928.

response: In World War I the club lost 76 members but Leake, "Slacker" Christison and Major Everett revived the club by 1919 and the club (and therefore the school to which it was affiliated) produced the captains of both Oxford and Cambridge in the Varsity Match. This was the first and only team this had happened. The 1920s saw the clubs strength grow and it produced its first international cap (to be won by a player playing for the club) in 1927 in the person of Kendrick Stark. In 1931 Eric Whiteley repeated the distinction. The club had over 600 members and was beating clubs like Rosslyn Park.
* - Kendrick Stark (1904–1988), England international (first capped 1927)Old Alleynians Sporting Honours
